post_text: This Friday, we celebrate Juneteenth! We are partnering with Bronx Native to celebrate the ending of slavery with cultural rituals, performances, food, and more. You don't want to miss it! Students and families, more details about this event are forthcoming. Please stay attentive to your emails. Reach out to Brandon with any questions or concerns.

post_text:
Last Friday, we held a School Wide Assembly addressing how the recent murders of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, Ahmaud Arbery and protests impacted our student community. How are our students personally, mentally, emotionally, and physically? What next steps can SBC take? We value hearing from our students and supporting their social-emotional health. The slides represent a few points we discussed as a community.

SBC provides a safe space for young voices to be heard. If you'd like to join our community, we are accepting applications for the Fall 2020 via www.southbronxcommunity.org.

post_text:
While battling the emotional, physical, mental and spiritual stress of a global pandemic, the 11th grade scholars at South Bronx Community Charter High School participated in a Mental Health Interdisciplinary Project (MHIP). The MHIP challenged scholars to focus on a mental health disorder and develop a creative project display that will showcase the important elements of the disorder. Scholars created podcasts, comic strips, magazines, posters and much more to increase awareness of their mental health disorder. Check them out here: http://www.southbronxcommunity.org/11th-grade-mental-health-interdisciplinary-project/.

This is the type of interdisciplinary work SBC provides for our young students. Families interested in joining the SBC community can apply via www.southbronxcommunity.org

SOUTHBRONXCOMMUNITY.ORG

post_text:
In 2016, the first cohort of freshmen walked through the doors of SBC. As we gathered in the dance room at Boricua College, we immediately knew this group of students were unique, destined to succeed and break barriers.

We hosted our very first College Decision day. Over 95% of our seniors have committed to college and we are incredibly proud of all the hard work they've put in over the last fours years. We can't wait to see how this new chapter transforms their lives! If you'd like to join the SBC community, do not hesitate to apply via our website, www.southbronxcommunity.org.

VIMEO.COM

post_text:
Our 4th Annual Career Day for our 9th grade students was a success! The COVID-19 pandemic did not deter us from providing the opportunity for our young students to meet with professionals from different fields. Students prepared a resume, learned interview skills/tips and discussed their career goals/aspirations. SBC provides college and career readiness resources to prepare young students starting from freshman year.

We are currently accepting more applications for the upcoming 2020-21 school year. If you are interested, please apply via www.southbronxcommunity.org.

post_text:
Greetings SBC Community!

You are invited to attend a virtual Open House to to learn more about what makes SBC unique and what we can offer to high school students. You will have the opportunity to speak with some of our current students and principals. Below are the Open House dates:

Tuesday, March 31st: 5-6pm
Friday, April 3rd: 2-3pm
Thursday, April 9th: 5-6pm

If you're interested in attending, please email Zulibeth Velazquez (zulibeth.velazquez@southbronxcommunity.org) for an invitation link. Please share among your friends and family. I look forward seeing you soon!

post_text: Our students at SBC learn by doing. Reflecting on our Dream Exhibition over the last three years reminds me that despite systemic injustices, our students still dream. It is not the American Dream we are sold. It is a dream that wells up from within them, one that invented whole genres of music, one that shapes our popular culture, and one that will propel them to be our future leaders. Thank you to everyone that has donated to our campaign. We want our scholars to dream big and design their futures. With your help, we are creating the opportunities to make that happen.
text: Our students at SBC learn by doing. Reflecting on our Dream Exhibition over the last three years reminds me that despite systemic injustices, our students still dream. It is not the American Dream we are sold. It is a dream that wells up from within them, one that invented whole genres of music, one that shapes our popular culture, and one that will propel them to be our future leaders. Thank you to everyone that has donated to our campaign. We want our scholars to dream big and design their futures. With your help, we are creating the opportunities to make that happen.

post_text: Watch Chris De La Cruz, one of our founding Learning Coaches, deliver an opening keynote at this year's SXSW Edu conference in Austin. He goes on just after minute 35 and finishes at minute 49. His story is a testament to the power of our 1:1 advising program at SBC and how to build meaningful relationships with young people. Phenomenal!

At South Bronx Community, we support our immigrant students and families who chose to stay home during #ADayWithoutImmigrants today. We can't imagine our school community without the rich cultural traditions and diverse perspectives that our students bring.

En South Bronx Community, apoyamos a nuestros estudiantes y familias inmigrantes quienes eligieron quedarse en casa hoy durante #UnDiaSinInmigrantes. No podemos imaginar nuestra comunidad escolar sin las tradiciones culturales y las perspectivas diversas que nuestros estudiantes traen.
